entry.title: Re: SAP Public Cloud 2508 / Question on the implementatio...
entry.content:
Hi Lukas,

Doing a quick check of the documentation and reviewing a sample in the Custom Logic app, it does not appear that custom fields are passed into the input parameters of this Badi.

However, if you have published your Custom Field and made it available in the available CDS View, you should be able to read it from the BADI using the importing parameter for the Supplier Invoice.

Something like this (I am not a good ABAPer so please work with a good developer) - disclaimer: I have not tested this ABAP code, but it should be pretty close.

SELECT SINGLE YY1_custFldInvoice01_MIH
           FROM I_SUPPLIERINVOICEAPI01
           INTO @DATA(lv_result)
           WHERE SupplierInvoice = @supplierinvoice.

Thank you

Jerry

entry.title: Re: RAP I_SalesOrderTP lock error on Update
entry.content:
Hello @Filo ,

I have prepared the following example shows how to update multiple schedule lines and it works as expected:

MODIFY ENTITIES OF i_salesordertp
  ENTITY SalesOrderScheduleLine
    UPDATE
      FIELDS ( requesteddeliverydate )
      WITH VALUE #(
        ( %key = VALUE #(
            salesorder     = '0000002261'
            salesorderitem = '000010'
            scheduleline   = '0001' )
          requesteddeliverydate = '20251025' )

        ( %key = VALUE #(
            salesorder     = '0000002261'
            salesorderitem = '000010'
            scheduleline   = '0002' )
          requesteddeliverydate = '20251026' )
      )
  FAILED   DATA(ls_failed)
  REPORTED DATA(ls_reported).

COMMIT ENTITIES.

 

This updates both schedule lines 001 and 002 for sales order 2261. I think it is better to check your internal table dlv.

entry.title: Re: Error when trying to display APPS - Joule in SAP S/4HANA Public Edition
entry.content: Hi triminh_le181, First, I checked whether the SAP users and roles had actually been replicated in the Workzone through the IPS job. After checking and succeeding in this step, I deleted the "NavigationService" destination and created it again, making sure to enter "/oauth/token" in the fields where you insert the token link obtained by the Workzone key. After that, I ran the test and the Joule was working normally.

entry.title: Re: Error when trying to display APPS - Joule in SAP S/4H...
entry.content:
I managed to resolve the issue by following these steps:

First, I verified that the SAP users and roles had indeed been replicated in the workzone through the IPS job.

After verifying and succeeding with this step, I deleted the "NavigationService" destination and created it again, making sure to enter "/oauth/token" in the fields where the token link obtained from the workzone key is entered.

Afterwards, I ran the test and the Joule was working normally.

entry.title: Re: Joule in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - Setup Guide
entry.content:
hi,
@Timo_Wortmann 

I was able to resolve the issue by following these steps:

First, I verified that the SAP users and roles had actually been replicated to the desktop using the IPS task.

After verifying and successfully completing this step, I deleted the "NavigationService" destination and recreated it, making sure to enter "/oauth/token" in the fields where the token link obtained from the desktop key is entered.

I then ran the test and Joule was working normally.

The problem was indeed related to the Destination. Thanks for your help.

entry.title: How to send POs in S/4HANA Public Cloud to custom partner function
entry.content:
Hello dear community, 

I have a question regarding the output parameter determination for Purchase Orders.

I would like to send the purchase order via mail to the supplier - but not to the standard-email-adresse from the BP.

Instead, there is a relationship between the supplier and a contact person. The contact person has a master data record including an e-mail-adress. The link between the contact person and the supplier is done via Z-partner function (=Z4). 

When I create a PO, I can see in ME21N under the "Partners" tab, that the partner function determination works properly, which means the system found Z4. 

Now, as described, the PO should not be sent to LF partner function but to Z4. In the Output Parameter Determination in the E-Mail-Recipient step, I selected "Z4" as role. The Email Address is set to "Default Email Address".

From my point of view that should work but when I create a PO. But the output is not generated after saving the PO.

When I check the print preview before saving the PO, I can see that the PO Output line was generated, but the "Country/Reg." and "Language" is blank eventhough both the fields are maintained in the contact person.

Does anyone have any idea? 

Thanks and regards!

entry.title: Limit item with Service Entry Sheet using Self Service Procurement Fiori app?
entry.content:
Dear experts,

We are on S/4 2023 and we are trying to implement Self Service Procurement, in combination with Lean Service functionality to replace the Gui based 'advanced' apps and classic SES.

Most variants I can get to work via 'My Purchase Requisitions', except for 1: A Service limit item with SES.

We are currently using classic SES functionality with item Category D and a limit item. It's then possible to post a SES for any value you need, as long as it's lower than the limit. But when I create a Limit item via 'My Purchase Requisitions', it creates a PR item with account assignment E (Enhanced limits), but then the Goods receipt indicator is off so you cannot post a SES. When creating such a PR via ME51N, there is a trick to switch the Good receipt indicator on before entering the item category E, but this does not work via the Fiori app of course. 

Does anyone knows if it's possible to create a limit item (E) with Goods Receipt (SES)  at all using the Fiori app?

Thanks in advance.

Jasper

The development of the Attendance Quota is a major enhancement that could not be completed in a single release.

We initially approached it in a way that would ensure the enhancements were only visible after the final release of the feature. Unfortunately, we have discovered that the enhancements are currently shown in Preview. We are working to make sure this will not be the case in Production.

entry.title: EU Triangular Trading workaround for intercompany invoice
entry.content:
Hi experts!

We have the following scenario in regards of triangular trading for which we need a solution for the intercompany invoices:

We order products in company code XX01 (Danish entity) with an external supplier SUP01 in Czech Republic. We want the products to be delivered to our 3PL distribution center in a different company code XX02 (German entity). Therefore we would have two invoices related to the same PO:

  • The supplier SUP01 should invoice company code XX01 and deliver the goods to company code XX02
  • And then we would need intercompany billing to happen between XX01 and XX02 company codes for these products. (were XX1 is acting as the "supplier" and XX02 is acting as the "buyer")

How could we setup such scenario? Has anyone had a similar situation?

Best regards,

Natalie

entry.title: Re: ABAP Cloud Developer Trial 2023 Available Now
entry.content:
Hi shrikantpatil, 

I apologise for the delay. Since ABAP Cloud Developer Trial relies on Community support, I can only provide a few guidelines.

I suggest you create a question (as described above), including the following information. More people are likely to see this question; therefore, you should get more responses:

1. When you run the following command, what response do you get?

ps -ef | grep sap

(This tells you whether the application is running, i.e. that sap work processes are running.)

2.

sapcontrol -nr 00 -function GetProcessList'

(If this returns green, then all SAP services are running.)

3. Lastly, when you run the following command, what response do you get?

R3 Trans -d

Best wishes,

Julie Plummer.

entry.title: Re: SAP PP or SAP MM
entry.content:
Hi, 

You're in a great position to pivot deeper into the SAP ecosystem, and your background gives you a solid foundation to build on. Here's some of the  breakdown of your options and some guidance to help you decide.

Your Current Strengths
5 years of hands-on SAP end-user experience in PP (Production Planning) and MM (Materials Management) modules.

Familiarity with key transactions like MFBF, MIGO, MB21‚ÄìMB23, and BMBC, which shows practical knowledge of inventory, procurement, and production processes.

Industry experience in solar energy, which is a growing and specialized sector.

Product certification experience (BIS, IEC, PVEL), which adds a compliance and quality assurance dimension to your profile.

BBA degree, giving you a business-oriented perspective.

SAP Career Path Options
1. SAP MM (Materials Management) Consultant
Pros:

High demand across industries, especially in procurement-heavy sectors.

Easier transition from your current MM end-user experience.

Opportunities to branch into SAP Ariba (cloud-based procurement).

Ideal for: Those interested in supply chain, procurement, and vendor management.

2. SAP PP (Production Planning) Consultant
Pros:

Strong fit with your manufacturing and production background in the solar industry.

High demand in manufacturing, automotive, and energy sectors.

Can lead to roles in SAP S/4HANA Manufacturing or SAP APO/IBP (advanced planning).

Ideal for: Those who enjoy process optimization and production workflows.

3. SAP QM (Quality Management)
Why it fits: Your current role in product certification aligns well with quality assurance and compliance.

Pros:

Niche but growing demand, especially in regulated industries (like solar, pharma, automotive).

Often integrates with PP and MM, so your existing knowledge is highly transferable.

Ideal for: Those interested in compliance, audits, and product quality.

4. SAP EHS (Environment, Health, and Safety)
Why it fits: Your experience with standards like BIS and IEC could be leveraged here.

Pros:

Specialized and less saturated field.

Relevant in industries with strict regulatory requirements.

Ideal for: Those interested in sustainability, safety, and regulatory compliance.

 

Hope it's informative for you.

entry.title: Re: Ability to filter Material Master Data's by if they h...
entry.content:
The Attachment Services is an 'external' object included in the Manage Product Master Data and not part of Master Data itself which is why it is not possible to filter on attachments details 

 

The API API_CV_ATTACHMENT_SRV and Entity GetAttachmentCount can be used to check if an Object has attachments against it 

 

The KBA https://me.sap.com/notes/3635843 outlines how to retrieve attachments adding using the DIR framework but it does not work for GOS

entry.title: SAP BDC Connect: SAP elevates bidirectional zero-copy data sharing with game-changing partnerships
entry.content:
We are excited to announce that SAP Business Data Cloud Connect, a service of SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC), is generally available to customers on all three key hyperscalers: Amazon Web Services (AWS), Google Cloud Platform (GCP), and Microsoft Azure.

What is SAP BDC Connect?

Earlier this month, SAP announced the launch of SAP BDC Connect, which enables secure, bidirectional data exchange between SAP BDC and partner systems ‚Äì expanding SAP‚Äôs open data ecosytem strategy. This integration utilizes zero-copy sharing, allowing data to remain within SAP systems while being accessible for analytics and AI in customers' existing data platforms. It facilitates bi-directional sharing and consumption of data products using Delta Sharing for zero-copy access, reducing traditional extraction complexities, and costs.

This initiative is designed to help organizations eliminate data silos, streamline their data value chain, and facilitate innovation and digital transformation using reliable data sources. Currently, this service is generally available with Databricks Data Intelligence Platform and in public preview for Google BigQuery.

SAP BDC Connect offers a unified, trusted data exchange platform that integrates data between SAP and non-SAP systems while preserving business context. It provides curated, high-quality data products for seamless use in analytics and AI, ensuring secure access with robust governance measures. The strategic partnership enhances this offering, empowering organizations to drive innovation and gain insights efficiently, leveraging advanced data engineering and machine learning capabilities to support informed decision-making.

What is Zero-Copy Data Sharing?

Zero-copy data sharing enables direct access to data across systems without the need for data replication or pipeline creation using Delta Sharing. Delta Sharing is an open protocol that enables secure, real-time data sharing across different platforms, allowing organizations to exchange live data without copying or moving it. This approach allows users to access SAP-managed and customer-managed data products directly through external systems, ensuring that data remains intact and semantically rich without being physically moved or duplicated.

Traditionally, extracting data from SAP applications involved complex processes that often led to the loss of valuable business context and required intricate reconciliation procedures in external repositories. Such methods were labor-intensive, prone to errors, and often resulted in data silos, which hindered data trust and innovation.

With zero-copy data sharing, organizations can run their workloads where their data resides, ensuring business semantics and data integrity stay intact. This allows organizations to access trusted data directly through secure protocols, maintaining governance within a data catalog, and eliminating the need for separate replication processes.

SAP BDC Connect for Enterprise Databricks

Earlier this year, we unveiled the integration of SAP Databricks, featuring Delta Sharing capabilities for seamless data exchange between SAP BDC and SAP Databricks. For an in-depth look at its key features and a demo video, I encourage you to check out my colleague's informative blog post: SAP Databricks in SAP Business Data Cloud : Unifying SAP Business Data with Lakehouse Intelligence.

As of today, this Delta Sharing capability is available with your existing enterprise Databricks tenants, unlocking enhanced capabilities for data engineering, advanced analytics, and AI/ML workloads.

Tenant Onboarding

To get started, you begin the process of onboarding your Databricks tenant to SAP BDC via the SAP for Me portal. This user-friendly interface allows you to configure essential details, including your system instance identifier, and obtain an invitation link to SAP BDC.

Once you have provisioned the BDC Connect tenant, you'll use the invitation link created by SAP to establish a connection from your Databricks tenant to SAP BDC. This process facilitates the necessary technical integration for SAP BDC Connect, setting up a secure communication channel with Databricks to enable bidirectional data exchange between the platforms, while keeping the complex technical integration behind the scenes.

For a detailed, step-by-step guide on how to onboard your Databricks tenant to SAP BDC and a helpful demo video, you can check out my colleague‚Äôs blog post: Provisioning SAP Business Data Cloud Connect and Enrolling with Existing Databricks.

After your tenant is onboarded, you can add your SAP BDC Connect instance to an existing formation in your Unified Customer Landscape. You can find more details in the help documentation.

Sharing Data Products from SAP BDC to Databricks

The SAP BDC Central Catalog, available through the SAP BDC cockpit, enables the discovery and sharing of data products originating from diverse source systems, encompassing both SAP and non-SAP data sources within the Unified Customer Landscape formation. The catalog enables users to search for data products and share them with the Databricks platform in a self-service manner, facilitating secure data exchange and live access to data.

The following demo video demonstrates the process of sharing data products and guides you on how to seamlessly consume them within your native Databricks system.

 

Sharing Data Products from Databricks to SAP BDC

Data scientists can create advanced analytics and derived data products in their Databricks notebook and share the data products with SAP BDC. Using the SAP Business Data Cloud SDK, these products are created in a pro-code environment and published to the BDC Catalog. Detailed steps for sharing data products to SAP BDC are accessible through the SAP help documentation.

Upon publication, these data products become available in the BDC Catalog within minutes, allowing further utilization through SAP Datasphere to install the product, develop analytic models, and create SAP Analytics Cloud stories for enhanced data visualization and decision-making insights.

Summary and Outlook

The integration of SAP BDC Connect and supported external systems for zero-copy data sharing is more than just a technological advancement; it's a strategic evolution that redefines how businesses access and utilize data. By curbing unnecessary data movement and governance challenges, customers can significantly lower operational costs and TCO, allowing businesses to prioritize innovation and growth.

As enterprises advance into AI-driven analytics, these strategic partnerships exemplify efficiency and trust, facilitating rapid business transformation and enhanced decision-making. Through SAP BDC Connect, customers can accelerating advanced analytics and AI/ML initiatives.

We're thrilled about the upcoming integrations with industry leaders through our strategic partnerships. We encourage you to keep an eye out for future blog posts, SAP BDC What‚Äôs New announcements, and updates from the SAP Road Map Explorer. We welcome your feedback and would love to hear what excites you the most about these developments.

entry.content:
DESCRIPTION:

The first Activity of this lesson is a gentle introduction to the hierarchy of AI, machine learning, deep learning, and Gen AI. Using business examples, this SAP Course showcases the progression of AI from rules-based intelligence to Generative AI. The concepts of basic intelligence, narrow AI and the promises of General AI are also discussed.  

The second Activity of this Academic Lesson is a Learning Journey comprised of five SAP Courses that explore fundamental constructs of large language models (LLMs) and AI, and how LLMs are best used for business cases. Prompt engineering and optimization is defined and illustrated in the Courses and learning is reenforced via hands-on prompt building in the SAP Gen-AI practice system.

Details of the Execution:

  • Transaction: MD74

  • Environment: LRP

  • Plant/Center: 5300

  • Material Number: L003351135NCPAA

  • Key Date for Deletion: The process was executed to clear data up to October 21, 2025 (21.10.2025).

  • Specific Item/Schedule Line: The issue pertains to the item identified as 18-102025 (or data up to the specified date for this item).

Problem Description:
After executing MD74 with the above parameters, the system does not generate an error message. However, upon verification, the VSF scheduling data for the specified material and center was not deleted. The data remains in the system, as confirmed in the attached screenshot.

Request for Investigation:

  2. Identify any underlying errors, locks, or master data inconsistencies that are preventing the deletion.

entry.title: Re: Impact on Customers When Downgrading Ariba Enterprise...
entry.content:
Hi,

Thank you for reaching out and for your question regarding the potential impacts of downgrading your SAP Business Network (SBN) account from Enterprise to Standard. We appreciate your proactive approach. 

In the interest of transparency and good collaboration, I strongly recommend informing your customers about this change. This will give them the opportunity to adjust their processes if necessary and ensure that your working relationship continues smoothly.

Some of the some potential impacts to consider are as below :

  • Feature Access: As a Standard plan user, you will no longer have access to certain Enterprise features and services that may have facilitated your transactions with your customers. For a comprehensive list of features that are exclusive to the Enterprise plan, please visit SAP Business Network Supplier Account | Pricing (see table).
  • Digitalization: One of the main differences is that the Standard plan does not support the automation of document processing by integrating directly with your backend systems.  Others include reporting, supplier insights, etc.
  • Access to SAP Business Network support (live chat, phone) for direct access to enablement experts, technical support, as well as digital account managers and online educational training courses.

Also note that you will need to check your conversion eligibility via your Business Network account first.

Should you need more detailed information on the supplier subscriptions, or anything else related, I also invite you to visit our dedicated Community page for suppliers here.  Alternatively feel free to ask either through the Community or get in touch with SAP Business Network Support team.

entry.title: Cross-company contribution margin
entry.content:
Hello,

We want to set up a contribution margin in S/4HANA. Classic way to do this is use the COGS posting during GI and the related revenue posting. The situation is here, that these are two different company codes. Company A manufactures the FG, sells it IC to company code B. Company code B sells the FG to the customer.

Revenue and COGS could happen in different periods, but of course COGS should only be shown if there are revenues. 

Furthermore reporting on actual costs are required, hence actual costing is considered.  There are two main characteristics to consider: profit center and plant of production.

Any solution or advice?

Thank you

entry.title: üå± Is the Sustainability Road Map still relevant? Absolutely ‚Äî and Here‚Äôs Why.
entry.content:
Sustainability doesn‚Äôt just matter ‚Äî it empowers our community to implement SAP Sustainability solutions more effectively. Today, sustainability is a strategic priority for every organization, directly influencing long-term profitability, brand reputation, and business resilience.

Recognizing this global movement, we‚Äôve continuously invested in enhancing our SAP Activate for Sustainability Roadmaps ‚Äî expanding, improving, and updating them to better guide our customers throughout their implementation journeys.

And now, we‚Äôre excited to announce a significant evolution:
Instead of one single Sustainability Roadmap, we‚Äôve released three new, dedicated roadmaps, each focused on a specific SAP Sustainability solution area:

  • for EHS environment management and EHS workplace safety.
  • for SAP Sustainability Control Tower.
  • for SAP Sustainability Footprint Management.

These new roadmaps are part of SAP Activate for Sustainability Management, helping you accelerate your Fit-to-Standard preparation and execution with tailored accelerators ‚Äî designed to make your implementation smoother and more effective.

What‚Äôs in it for you?

If you‚Äôre implementing any of the Sustainability Management solutions mentioned above, you now have access to two powerful accelerators:

  1. Show and Tell ‚Äì Ready-to-use materials for interactive Fit-to-Standard sessions, helping business users visualize and understand key solution capabilities.
  2. Fit-to-Standard Questionnaire ‚Äì A structured guide to capture insights, define requirements, and scope processes during workshops.

Together, these assets save valuable project time, enhance collaboration, and provide clear direction for configuration and planning after the workshops. Each document follows a consistent, guided structure ‚Äî ensuring a professional and efficient experience for your teams.

So, what are you waiting for?

Explore the new SAP Sustainability Roadmaps today in the SAP Roadmap Viewer and see how they can accelerate your sustainability transformation.

entry.title: Re: Variable Pay eligibility based on Absence/leave types...
entry.content:
Hi @tatiana_caraima 

I've never built this specific requirement in a standard varpay configuration where the rules would fully exclude the person from even getting a record retrieved from EC. However in customized varpay configs with Assignment Level Custom Fields I've done these kind of checks where you count within each record the number of days an employee has spent on a specific value (here event reason which should be equal to time type) then you do the check at the entry level and set final payout to 0.

What I can say to come back to your requirement  is that when I built the test case for this blog I struggled to get data from the Time Off Module in a consistent way (for example in case someone had overlapping entries or entries not yet approved), which is the reason for the first paragraph advocating for an additional custom field in Job Info with a business rule to copy the time off entry into it so we can reliably use that in our Main Record Eligibility Rule.

Hence if you've already spent a lot of time building this and can't make it work then I would suggest trying to build this through an MDF object with on Save rule (User ID to trigger the On Save for each user could be populated from Integration center so there is no csv upload needed). MDFs support Time Off module better and it would actually display the number of days for each user in that MDF so it would help the customer validate data too.

Hope these ideas will help trigger the spark to make this happen.

All the best,

Xavier

entry.title: Import Tab in Purchase Order for Intercompany Stock Transfer with Cross-border Storage Location
entry.content:
Good day,

We are on SAP ECC 6.0.

We have a plant that is located in Germany with an issuing storage location in a different EU country. 

Whenever we do an STO (PO type UD) from that issuing storage location in the Netherlands to a storage location in Germany, we need to report Intrastat data and therefore we need the import data. The storage location in the Netherlands has an address assigned.

However, the import tab does not appear when we enter the Dutch issuing storage location on item level. This seems because the import-tab activation check is done one header level and it compares the company code country with the supplying plant country. If those are the same, then no import tab appears. 

SAP considers this cross-border STO not a cross-border STO, even though it is because of how the import-tab check works.

Via the path Materials Management -> Purchasing -> Foreign Trade/Customs -> Control Foreign Trade Data in MM and SD Documents ->Import screens in purchasing document we can make sure the import tab is always displayed, even when it is not required (goods moving from DE > DE).

Any possibilities to make the import tab appear when the country of the issuing storage location is not the same as the supplying plant country?

 

Thanks in advance.

 

Floyd

entry.title: Introducing Horizon Themes and Usability Enhancements in SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
A Fresh Look and a Smoother Experience for All Users

We are excited to announce the introduction of the Horizon themes in SAP Analytics Cloud a modern, cohesive visual language aligned across SAP‚Äôs product suite. You will have access to Morning and Evening Horizon, the light and dark themes as well as to the high contrast white and black themes.

This release also brings a series of improvements to the side navigation, user profile, user settings, and the search, making it easier than ever to find insights and personalize your application.

 

Horizon Themes: Modern, Accessible, and Unified

The introduction of Horizon themes marks the next step in our user experience journey. These themes feature clean lines, contemporary color palettes, and improved contrasts, resulting in visually appealing UI that remain comfortable for extended work sessions. Accessibility is at the heart of Horizon, with thoughtful color selections and focus indicators for every user. The experience remains consistent as you move between SAP Analytics Cloud and other SAP solutions, offering a unified interface that supports productivity and ease of use. Personalize your experience by choosing from light, dark, and high contrast theme variants‚Äîsimply head to your user settings to select your preferred look.

The Belize theme will remain the default in Q4 and continue to be available for the next few quarters. Looking ahead, Horizon will become the standard theme in the first half of 2026. If you‚Äôd like to enable Horizon for your organization sooner, simply navigate to the administration section under default appearance to set Horizon as your tenant‚Äôs default theme.

 

Improved User Profile and Settings

The user profile and settings have been reimagined to put key information and settings at your fingertips. Instantly access your account details, profile image, and settings in one clear and organized dialog. Additionally, the ‚ÄúAbout‚Äù section is now conveniently located within your user profile making key information more accessible whenever you need it.

 

Simplified and Adaptive Side Navigation

The redesigned side navigation bar logically organizes content and tools for easy access. Collapsible sections expand your workspace, and in collapsed view, hovering over each symbol shows module names to help you quickly find what you need.

 

More Convenient Search

The search now features autocomplete, making it noticeably more convenient and user-friendly. As you begin typing, relevant suggestions appear instantly, streamlining the process of finding models, stories, and files. This enhancement helps you locate what you need more efficiently, even if you can‚Äôt recall exact names, ensuring a smoother search experience.

These updates are based on user feedback and extensive research, reflecting SAP‚Äôs commitment to delivering an analytics platform that is powerful, accessible, and a pleasure to use. The Horizon themes and experience enhancements aim to reduce friction, promote creativity, and empower you to shape insights in a visually appealing and highly functional space.

 

What's Next

You can continue to style your SAP Analytics Cloud Stories independently, as the story theme mechanism will remain unchanged and won't follow the overall SAC theme.

With the Q1 2026 release, we plan to update the preferences for new stories and make the Horizon Morning theme available in every story; both Morning and Evening Horizon themes are currently available on GitHub.

The new Horizon themes and user experience improvements will be available mid-November in the Q4 2025 SAP Analytics Cloud release.

If you have feedback on the Horizon themes or the planned story theme updates, please reach out to me by message or in the comments.

I hope you‚Äôre doing well!
I‚Äôm trying to retrieve the task list operations for a specific material, similar to what SAP transaction CA03 displays.

Here‚Äôs what I‚Äôve done so far: Joined tables like MAPL, PLKO, PLFL, PLAS, and PLPO. (I tried also without PLFL)

What I noticed is that CA03 seems to show sometimes operations for task list type ‚ÄúS‚Äù.

Any advice on whether my approach is correct or if I need to consider something else?
Thanks a lot for your help!

 

CODE:
SELECT plpo.VORNR,
plpo.STEUS,
plpo.ARBID,
plpo.WERKS,
plpo.LTXA1,
plpo.BMSCH,
plpo.VGE01, plpo.VGW01,
plpo.VGE02, plpo.VGW02,
plpo.VGE03, plpo.VGW03
FROM MAPL mapl
JOIN PLKO plko
ON mapl.PLNTY = plko.PLNTY
AND mapl.PLNNR = plko.PLNNR
AND mapl.PLNAL = plko.PLNAL
AND mapl.MANDT = plko.MANDT
AND plko.LOEKZ = ''
JOIN PLFL plfl
ON plko.PLNTY = plfl.PLNTY
AND plko.PLNNR = plfl.PLNNR
AND plko.PLNAL = plfl.PLNAL
AND plko.MANDT = plfl.MANDT
AND plfl.LOEKZ = ''
JOIN PLAS plas
ON plfl.PLNTY = plas.PLNTY
AND plfl.PLNNR = plas.PLNNR
AND plfl.PLNFL = plas.PLNFL
AND plfl.PLNAL = plas.PLNAL
AND plfl.MANDT = plas.MANDT
AND plas.LOEKZ = ''
JOIN PLPO plpo
ON plas.PLNTY = plpo.PLNTY
AND plas.PLNNR = plpo.PLNNR
AND plas.PLNKN = plpo.PLNKN
AND plas.MANDT = plpo.MANDT
WHERE mapl.MANDT = '100'
AND mapl.MATNR = '<MATERIAL_NUMBER>'
AND mapl.WERKS = '<PLANT_CODE>'
AND plko.DATUV <= CURRENT_DATE
AND mapl.PLNNR = '<ROUTING_NUMBER>'
AND mapl.PLNAL = '<ALTERNATIVE_NUMBER>'
ORDER BY plpo.VORNR;

entry.title: SAP IAS Implementation on an SAP ECC on premise and direct API endpoints.
entry.content:
Hello!

I have been working in the implementation of IAS for my SAP system. The goal is to protect UI5 applications with MFA. So far so good, when the user wants to log in, is redirected to the IAS login page, where MFA is enforced. After a successful logon the user is redirected back to the corresponding UI5 application.

As an example, let's assume I have a UI5 application where users go to create purchase orders, this works all fine as long as you do it the legit way, but if I wanted to instead of using the UI5 application just identify the API endpoint to create purchase orders and then hit that directly using postman for example, it would let me do it just fine as long as I put my user id and password in the request headers.

To me this kind of defeats the purpose of MFA, but I am not sure if this is by design or I am missing something. Has anyone been here before? Is there something additional I need to do to enforce MFA on API endpoints?

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: ChaRM 4 system landscape not importing to Pre-Prod
entry.content:
Hi Everyone,

We are implementing a 4 system landscape with ChaRM, and we have activated the Preliminary Import functionality.  

Flow is this:  DEV--> QA-->PreProd--> Prod

My understanding is that with the preliminary import activated, the Change Document for a normal change is marked as "successfully tested" then the transport is released from the Dev system, imported into the QA system, and put in the buffer for the PreProd.  Based on the documentation, the task list should not have to be used as no Basis involvement is required with the preliminary import activated.

I'm referencing this documentation.

Preliminary Import of Normal Changes | SAP Help Portal

What is happening in my case, is that the QA transport --not the ToC--is being imported into QA only after I perform the step "approve preliminary import".  And for the PreProd import, that only is happening after "Tested for Production Import" step.  Neither of these makes sense, as you're approving it was tested in PreProd before it's even been imported--my understanding is that the transport is supposed to be imported, but left in the PreProd buffer until final approval.

Any assistance is greatly appreciated.

entry.title: Part 2: Architecting SaaS Resilience Against S/4HANA Variance
entry.content:
Part 1: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-members/building-saas-products-on-sap-btp/ba-p/14231929 

The hidden complexity: landscape variance in S/4HANA

If you are building a multitenant Software as a Service (SaaS) application on SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP), you face one primary, often unspoken challenge: Landscape Variance.

When connecting to a customer's S/4HANA system, you cannot assume a standardized business process configuration. One customer might use Purchase Requisitions; another might bypass them entirely. A third might have a legacy system feeding Purchase Orders (POs) via EDI. Your core SaaS architecture, built on rigid assumptions about S/4HANA objects, immediately breaks down.

The Clean Core strategy is our defense against this chaos. It's not just about keeping S/4HANA standard; it‚Äôs about architecting a resilient, multitenant application that survives the reality of heterogeneous customer landscapes.

The two-system solution: CAP as the translation layer

The solution is to tightly separate concerns, positioning the Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP) as the mission-critical translation layer between your standard SaaS logic and the customer‚Äôs unique S/4HANA core.

S/4HANA: the unknown system of record

This system is the source of truth, but it‚Äôs inherently variable. Our golden rule: The SaaS product must only interact with versioned APIs exposed by S/4HANA, never raw objects. The core system‚Äôs internal processes remain irrelevant to the application logic as long as the API contract is met.

BTP - CAP: the resilient service layer

CAP provides the necessary framework for multitenancy, data normalization, and extension handling. This is where we implement the Clean Core strategy.

The CAP Service Layer,  acts as the common data model for your application. We rely on three core CAP capabilities to manage landscape variance:

  • Normalization: Custom handlers are implemented to take the messy, variant data from the S/4HANA API and map it into the unified CDS entities that your SaaS front-end and business logic consume.

  • Multitenancy and Isolation: CAP automatically handles the creation and management of isolated database containers (in SAP HANA Cloud) for each tenant, ensuring complete data segregation.

  • Extension Model: This is where CAP truly shines in solving the variance problem, particularly for custom fields and extensions (Trigger 2 below).

CAP solves the three triggers for BTP logic

The moment you encounter a potential difference in a customer‚Äôs landscape, that logic must be placed in BTP, within the CAP layer.

Trigger 1: core process variations (process normalization)

The Problem: Customer A uses Purchase Requisitions, Customer B uses Direct POs. Your SaaS app needs a single ProcurementDocument entity.

The CAP Solution: We use custom service handlers within CAP to implement a Process Normalization Layer.

  • The CAP service intercepts the request for ProcurementDocument.

  • A tenant-specific check determines the appropriate S/4HANA API flow (e.g., calling the Requisitions API for Tenant A, or the PO API for Tenant B).

  • The handler then maps the resulting S/4 data structure into the unified SaaS.ProcurementDocument CDS entity, hiding the underlying process variance from the consumer.

Trigger 2: custom field and extension variations (the CDS extension mechanism)

The Problem: Your base model assumes fields X, Y, Z on a Purchase Order. Customer A added custom field industryClassification, and Customer B needs custom field legacyID.

The CAP Solution: We leverage the CAP Multitenancy and the CDS Extension Mechanism.

Your base CAP service model (CDS) remains non-modified (Core Model Protection). When Customer A is onboarded, an extension CDS file is deployed only to their tenant container.

  • Example CDS Extension:

    extend entity SaaS.PurchaseOrder with {
    industryClassification : String(50);
};

  • Result: The new field is automatically merged into the database schema and OData/REST service endpoint only for Tenant A. The core application logic and data model remain intact, allowing for graceful, tenant-specific schema variance without core code changes.

Trigger 3: process change detection (runtime adaptation)

The Problem: A customer changes their S/4HANA configuration (e.g., disabling a process or upgrading).

The CAP possible solution: Build runtime adaptation logic into your service handlers. This involves:

  • Periodically scanning the S/4HANA landscape metadata for changes (APIs available, field availability).

  • Using this metadata in the CAP handlers to adjust runtime logic dynamically (e.g., if API A is disabled, automatically route the query to the fallback logic using API B).

  • CAP's contract stability ensures that while the integration logic changes internally, the external SaaS API remains stable.

Critical considerations for CAP deployment

While CAP provides the technical solution, architects must recognize the operational and cost implications of this strategy. This architectural decision carries hidden costs and effort that must be budgeted correctly:

  • Landscape Discovery: This is not a one-time setup. You must budget 1‚ÄìN weeks of specialized S/4HANA expert time per customer to interpret their configuration and guide the necessary CAP adapter development.

  • Normalization Cost: The development of the mapping engine and custom service handlers in CAP requires significant upfront time and continued maintenance. This layer is the work that truly delivers resilience, and it must be prioritized. (Can be classified as Customer cost - if You need extensions You can do it on Your own).

  • Onboarding Timeline: Be honest with stakeholders‚Äîyour onboarding timeline will be 6‚Äì8 weeks, not 2, due to the mandatory discovery and adapter build phase.

The Clean Core approach, implemented through the robust multitenancy and extension capabilities of SAP CAP, is the only sustainable strategy for building SaaS in the variance-rich SAP ecosystem.

I am currently working on a comprehensive SaaS template built on CAP and BTP, designed to automate much of this landscape discovery and normalization process, providing a robust, pre-configured foundation for partners and developers building solutions in the SAP ecosystem.

Stay Tuned!
